job_details.Functieomschrijving:
* Software Testability is responsible to ensure that all features are designed and implemented in a testable way by guiding product teams during the entire lifecycle is responsible to enable product teams to deliver quality products at pace by advocating for teams to verify and test work in isolated independent units and embed testing early in the lifecycle
     * Non-functional Testing has sufficient knowledge to advocate for the users experience by raising the team's ability to build applications with clear non-functional requirements (eg performance, security, accessibility, usability)Has sufficient knowledge to ensure teams keep within non-functional requirements by performing tests such as load-testing, accessibility testing, or security testing
     * Test Planning & Execution is responsible to plan, execute, and supervise testing of products and features by using techniques such as risk-based testing, exploratory testing, mobbing, pairing, or responsible to identify and investigate issues and ensure they are handled in a sustainable and repeatable way by using continuous improvement techniques
     * Test Advocacy is responsible to ensure that testing is embedded in the lifecycle of the product by being involved in the planning and design stages of applications and services Is responsible to advocate for testing best practices by explaining why testing is required, and enables others to own testing and quality checks of the product
     * Test Automation has sufficient knowledge to drive and coordinate collaborative improvements of the test automation infrastructure and processes in teams by outlining the pros and cons of automation, where it can be effective, and where it cannot be used. Has sufficient knowledge to increase the overall quality of tests for a product by building automated tests that are isolated, deterministic, valuable and provide fast, reliable feedback.
     * Critical Thinking: responsible to systematically identify patterns and underlying issues in complex situations, and to find solutions by applying logical and analytical thinking is responsible to constructively evaluate and develop ideas, plans and solutions by reviewing them, objectively taking into account external knowledge, initiating 'SMART' improvements and articulating their rationale
     * Continuous Quality and Process Improvement: responsible to identify opportunities for process, system and structural improvements (i.e performance gains) by examining and evaluating current process flows, methods and standards
     * Responsible to design and implement relevant improvements by defining adapted/new process flows, standards, and practices that enable business performance
     * Effective Communication is responsible to deliver clear, well-structured, and meaningful information to a target audience by using suitable communication mediums and language tailored to the audience
     * Responsible to achieve mutually agreeable solutions by staying adaptable, communicating ideas in clear coherent language and practising active listening
     * Responsible to ask relevant (follow-up) questions to properly engage with the speaker and really understand what they are saying, by applying listening and reflection techniques
     * This role may require to be on an on-call rotation
job_details.full_text:
Test Engineer II - Intent Discovery

* Software Testability is responsible to ensure that all features are designed and implemented in a testable way by guiding product teams during the entire lifecycle is responsible to enable product teams to deliver quality products at pace by advocating for teams to verify and test work in isolated independent units and embed testing early in the lifecycle
     * Non-functional Testing has sufficient knowledge to advocate for the users experience by raising the team's ability to build applications with clear non-functional requirements (eg performance, security, accessibility, usability)Has sufficient knowledge to ensure teams keep within non-functional requirements by performing tests such as load-testing, accessibility testing, or security testing
     * Test Planning & Execution is responsible to plan, execute, and supervise testing of products and features by using techniques such as risk-based testing, exploratory testing, mobbing, pairing, or responsible to identify and investigate issues and ensure they are handled in a sustainable and repeatable way by using continuous improvement techniques
     * Test Advocacy is responsible to ensure that testing is embedded in the lifecycle of the product by being involved in the planning and design stages of applications and services Is responsible to advocate for testing best practices by explaining why testing is required, and enables others to own testing and quality checks of the product
     * Test Automation has sufficient knowledge to drive and coordinate collaborative improvements of the test automation infrastructure and processes in teams by outlining the pros and cons of automation, where it can be effective, and where it cannot be used. Has sufficient knowledge to increase the overall quality of tests for a product by building automated tests that are isolated, deterministic, valuable and provide fast, reliable feedback.
     * Critical Thinking: responsible to systematically identify patterns and underlying issues in complex situations, and to find solutions by applying logical and analytical thinking is responsible to constructively evaluate and develop ideas, plans and solutions by reviewing them, objectively taking into account external knowledge, initiating 'SMART' improvements and articulating their rationale
     * Continuous Quality and Process Improvement: responsible to identify opportunities for process, system and structural improvements (i.e performance gains) by examining and evaluating current process flows, methods and standards
     * Responsible to design and implement relevant improvements by defining adapted/new process flows, standards, and practices that enable business performance
     * Effective Communication is responsible to deliver clear, well-structured, and meaningful information to a target audience by using suitable communication mediums and language tailored to the audience
     * Responsible to achieve mutually agreeable solutions by staying adaptable, communicating ideas in clear coherent language and practising active listening
     * Responsible to ask relevant (follow-up) questions to properly engage with the speaker and really understand what they are saying, by applying listening and reflection techniques
     * This role may require to be on an on-call rotation

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional software testing methodologies, test planning, execution, and automation. While it mentions 'Intent Discovery', the core responsibilities and required skills do not align with the development or application of AI/ML models or generative AI technologies. The role appears to be a specialized test engineering position rather than an AI/ML or GenAI engineering role.

job_tasks.justification: The description emphasizes ensuring features are designed and implemented in a testable way, guiding product teams on testing early in the lifecycle, and building automated tests. This aligns with the software development lifecycle where testing is a critical component.
job_tasks.phrase: ensure that all features are designed and implemented in a testable way

job_tasks.justification: The role involves advocating for testing best practices and enabling others to own testing and quality checks, which is a part of the software development process.
Building automated tests that are isolated, deterministic, valuable, and provide fast, reliable feedback is a core software development activity within a testing context.
job_tasks.phrase: building automated tests that are isolated, deterministic, valuable and provide fast, reliable feedback

job_tasks.justification: The description mentions performing tests such as load-testing, accessibility testing, or security testing, which are integral parts of ensuring the quality and robustness of software applications.
job_tasks.phrase: performing tests such as load-testing, accessibility testing, or security testing

job_tasks.justification: Planning, executing, and supervising testing of products and features using various techniques is a fundamental software development task related to quality assurance.
job_tasks.phrase: plan, execute, and supervise testing of products and features

job_tasks.justification: Identifying and investigating issues and ensuring they are handled in a sustainable and repeatable way falls under the software development lifecycle for bug resolution and quality management.
job_tasks.phrase: identify and investigate issues and ensure they are handled in a sustainable and repeatable way

job_tasks.justification: Driving and coordinating improvements of the test automation infrastructure and processes is a software development activity focused on enhancing the testing framework.
job_tasks.phrase: drive and coordinate collaborative improvements of the test automation infrastructure and processes

job_tasks.justification: The responsibility to design and implement relevant improvements by defining adapted/new process flows, standards, and practices is a software development task focused on process optimization.
job_tasks.phrase: design and implement relevant improvements by defining adapted/new process flows, standards, and practices

job_tasks.justification: While 'Intent Discovery' is mentioned, the context provided is about testing and quality assurance, not about building or training predictive or generative models. The phrase is likely referring to testing a feature that discovers user intent, rather than developing the discovery model itself.
The description explicitly mentions critical thinking, systematically identifying patterns and underlying issues, and finding solutions by applying logical and analytical thinking.
job_tasks.phrase: systematically identify patterns and underlying issues in complex situations, and to find solutions by applying logical and analytical thinking

job_tasks.justification: Constructively evaluating and developing ideas, plans, and solutions by reviewing them objectively is a key aspect of problem-solving and pragmatic approach.
job_tasks.phrase: constructively evaluate and develop ideas, plans and solutions by reviewing them, objectively

job_tasks.justification: The role requires identifying opportunities for process, system, and structural improvements and examining current process flows, methods, and standards, which implies a need for continuous learning and adaptation.
job_tasks.phrase: identify opportunities for process, system and structural improvements (i.e performance gains) by examining and evaluating current process flows, methods and standards

job_tasks.justification: The description emphasizes delivering clear, well-structured, and meaningful information to a target audience using suitable communication mediums and language tailored to the audience.
job_tasks.phrase: deliver clear, well-structured, and meaningful information to a target audience by using suitable communication mediums and language tailored to the audience

job_tasks.justification: Achieving mutually agreeable solutions by staying adaptable, communicating ideas in clear coherent language and practicing active listening are core communication and collaboration skills.
job_tasks.phrase: achieve mutually agreeable solutions by staying adaptable, communicating ideas in clear coherent language and practising active listening

job_tasks.justification: Asking relevant (follow-up) questions to properly engage with the speaker and really understand what they are saying, by applying listening and reflection techniques, is a direct indicator of communication and collaboration skills.
job_tasks.phrase: ask relevant (follow-up) questions to properly engage with the speaker and really understand what they are saying, by applying listening and reflection techniques
